intro: Astracantha kuhistana, commonly known as the Kuhistani thornveld, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Afghanistan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, commonly known as the carrot or parsley family. The plant is characterized by its spiny stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in clusters. It is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments with minimal water availability. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local flora and ecological balance in its habitat.
